newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bundesbank sets tender for 12-day repos at 3 pct.
newsitem.headline: Bundesbank sets tender for 12-day repos at 3 pct.

text.p: The Bundesbank said on Monday it was setting a tender for 12-day securities repurchase funds, offering banks liquidity at a fixed rate of 3.00 percent.
Funds will be credited to accounts on Friday, December 27 and the securities have to be repurchased on January 8.
A 73.9 billion-mark repo pact expires on Friday. The repo rates has been fixed at 3.00 percent since late August.
The repo tenders are usually set on Tuesdays with allocations following on Wednesdays but the dates have been changed this week because of the Christmas holiday.
